question: What large astronomical structure, consisting of stars, stellar remnants, gas, dust, and dark matter all gravitationally interacting?

Which two elements comprise approximately 99% of the Earth’s atmosphere?

Developed and named by James Lovelock, what is the name of the theory that all living organisms interact with their inorganic surroundings to form a self-regulating system for life on Earth? It’s named after the Greek goddess of the Earth

Which term refers to carnivores that primarily consume fish?

a mixture of chemical elements of which at least one is a metal
a substance consisting of very large molecules called macromolecules, composed of many repeating subunits
a molecule that is seemingly repelled from a mass of water due to its nonpolarity
